meanings.definition: A unit of time equal to one billionth of a second.
meanings.sent1: He measured the speed of light in nanoseconds using advanced equipment.
meanings.sent2: The computer processed data in nanoseconds, making tasks quicker.
meanings.sent3: Waiting for the kettle to boil felt like it took a million nanoseconds.
meanings.sent4: In the blink of an eye, the race was over, lasting only a few nanoseconds.
meanings.sent5: The nanoseconds ticked by slowly during the boring lecture.

meanings.sent1: She made a decision in nanoseconds, not wanting to waste any time.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm passed in nanoseconds, leaving behind a rainbow.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attention span lasted only a few nanoseconds before moving on.
meanings.sent4: The actor's career lasted mere nanoseconds before fading into obscurity.
meanings.sent5: In the world of technology, nanoseconds can make a huge difference in performance.
